variants.Description in input context: c.1234G>A (p.G412D) variant associated with early-onset Parkinson's disease.
c.567A>T (p.K189M) variant linked to loss of parkin ubiquitin ligase activity.

Material used.Description: HEK293T cells were transiently transfected with plasmids encoding wild-type and mutant parkin variants.

Readout description.Result Description: Reduced ubiquitin ligase activity by 60% compared to wild-type parkin.
No detectable ubiquitin ligase activity in mutant parkin-expressing cells.

Biological replicates.Description: Three independent transfections were performed across different cell passages.

Technical replicates.Description: Each western blot was performed in triplicate with independent protein lysates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type parkin-expressing HEK293T cells used as positive control.

Basic negative control.Description: Empty vector-transfected HEK293T cells used as negative control.

Statistical analysis method.Statistical analysis method: Student's t-test with p < 0.05 considered significant.

Threshold for normal readout.Threshold for normal readout: Ubiquitin ligase activity â‰¥ 80% of wild-type levels

Threshold for abnormal readout.Threshold for abnormal readout: Ubiquitin ligase activity < 40% of wild-type levels

Material used.Description: Brain lysates from PARK2-/- mice and wild-type littermates were used for co-immunoprecipitation experiments.

Readout description.Result Description: Mutant parkin failed to co-precipitate with ubiquitin, unlike wild-type parkin.

Technical replicates.Description: Each immunoprecipitation was repeated twice with independent lysates.

Basic positive control.Description: Wild-type mouse brain lysates used as positive control.
